steps.title: Select the celery
steps.content: Select the celery . Celery should be firm, crisp, and not wilted when purchased. Avoid any blemished stalks or cracked stalks. Store in the fridge in a plastic bag or with the tail end sitting in a little water. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enjoy celery raw.
steps.content: Enjoy celery raw. Both the stalks and the leaves are edible. Add chopped celery to salads or as sticks with dips. For the kids, spread nut butter into the centre of the stalk and place sultanas at even intervals, to make "ants on a log". [2] X Research source Remove the stringy parts if you find that the stalks are too tough.

steps.title: Stir-fry celery
steps.content: Stir-fry celery . Add celery to your stir-fry for a crunchy, tasty improvement. Slice it on an angle, about finger length for inclusion. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Turn celery into soup.
steps.content: Turn celery into soup. Celery soup is creamy and nutritious, and is very warming on cold days. It goes perfectly with crunchy bread or toast. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Add celery to stews and casseroles.
steps.content: Add celery to stews and casseroles. It's a delicious addition that helps to make the vegetables go further.

steps.title: Use the celery leaves.
steps.content: Use the celery leaves. Celery leaves can be used for various dishes, to add flavour. Use in stock, broth, soup, or in salads. Celery leaves also make great garnishes. [5] X Research source Use them to flavor and garnish a fish.
